text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I'm going to show

you what I'm calling my margherita pizza quiche,
you can also call it a caprese quiche, you
can also call it a tomato amd mozzarella quiche.

You can also just sit it at the table, and
sit down and statt zitt.
You know what?

Whatever you wanna do just put this on the
table, it is so delicious, and I feel like
it's that perfect dish to serve at a brunch.

If you're having something a little fancier,
let's say it's Mother's Day or Father's Day

or just an in general Spring or Summer brunch,
this is fabulous because it serves at room

temperature, everybody loves it, it requires
like little to no effort, few ingredients,
all the right ones.
Let's get cracking.

Alright, first thing is first, you pie crust,
I'm using a store bought pie crust that I

put in my 9 inch pie dish, you want to make
sure that you put a little bit of oil at the

bottom so that nothing sticks, eggs, cherry
tomatoes, lots of grated mozzarella, you're

going to need some oregano, parmeggiano reggiano,
salt, and you'll also need a little bit of

heavy cream and some fresh basil and a little
bit of olive oil.
That's it.
It's so easy, you're going to love it!

Let's work on the crust first, I bought my
crust pre-done, why you might ask?

Because I got 50 million things to do today
and making pie crust is not at the top of
that priority list.

But truly, whenever pie crust goes on sale
if it's a brand that you love, stock up.

Keep it in the freezer, because a lot of people
don't like making pie crust from scratch and
that's fine.
So, I've got my oven preheated to 400F.

I'm just going to take my fork and I'm going
to stab it a little bit around the bottom

and the edges, kind of a little everywhere
and then I'm going to take a piece of aluminum

foil and I'm going to put if shiny side down,
and I'm going to blind bake this for a bit,

I'm going to fill it with some dry beans,
you can use rice or you can buy pie weights,

which I think is a waste of money because
they're expensive and it's no different than
using dry beans.

Pop this into the oven at 400F for ten minutes,
after the ten minutes, you're going to take

off the foil with the beans and pop it back
in for fifteen minutes, so in total the pie

crust needs to bake for twenty five minutes,
ten minutes with the foil on fifteen minutes

with the foil off, I will show you what it
looks like when it is there.

My crust looks fantastic, in total it was
in the oven for about twenty three minutes,

I took it out - when I took the foil off it
went back in for about thirteen minutes and

it's perfect, this is the only chance your
crust is going to have to develop that beautiful

color because once we add the eggs on top,
this is going to get covered so you want to
make sure it's fully cooked through.

Now, to the mixture, you need eggs - the custard
mixture I suppose, a little bit of cream,
a pinch of salt and a grating of parm.

A couple of tablespoons, not much, I don't
want to overwhelm it but at the same time

I want that same cheesy salty bite that it
gives, and you could add black pepper to this

if you want to but I'm going to omit it for
right now, but you can if you want to.

And then, you just give this a nice little
whisk.

So that's ready, I just want to season my
tomatoes really lightly with some salt, it's

really important that you really season every
layer of your dish if it has multiple layers.

The tiniest bit of olive oil, teaspoon maybe,
no more than that.

And a good pinch of dried oregano, and you
just kind of toss these together because I

want every layer of my food to have wonderful
flavor.

I don't want any parts of it to feel bland
or kind of like blah, you know what I mean?

So now, you take your custard and you pour
that in your pie crust, in your pie shell.
You top it with your cheese.
It's going to be so lovely.
And then you just top it with the tomatoes.

I just like to put them cut side up, so it's
really pretty when it's done, but does it
matter?
No, it's gonna taste delicious either way.
That looks pretty delicious.
And then one for me.
Because I've earned it.

Okay, back into the oven for twenty minutes
or until golden, let it cool completely, then
we serve.
I know!

My beautiful quiche was in the oven, it went
back in for about twenty minutes, I let it

come to room temperature, for quite a bit
- it's still, I don't want to say warm but
it's you know luke-ish warm?

It's not hot, you don't want it to be hot
otherwise it could fall apart when you go

to cut it, so you definitely want this to
come to room temperature.
But it's even better if you can.

is melty.
What a home run and a half!

Crispy crust, it's like perfection in every
